name: Vintage 1980s Morton Myles Cocktail Dress
description:
Stunning 1980s dress by Morton Myles for the Warrens. Myles is renowned for dressing Jackie O - she wore one of his amazing dresses on the cover of Look Magazine in the 1960s. 
 This dress is a stunning example and was stocked in the high end Altman department store. Rouched bodice and satin skirt. Zip to side. 

In excellent condition.

Size UK 8

name: Vintage 1970s Ossie Clark Black Maxi Dress
description:
A classic Ossie Clark for Radley black maxi dress, circa 1970. In Ossie's signature crepe fabric with chiffon bell shaped sleeves and a figure skimming cut. The deep V neckline and open-back style is reminiscent of his famous, sought after 'Cuddly' design. The chiffon ties at the neck before draping over the the open back. There are further ties at the back of the waist. Below the ties is a further open area of fabric, which isn't quite visible in the picture as the ties drape over the area. From the waist down the dress is lined.

This is a rare and sought after item and is in particularly good condition. Due to the nature of the crepe fabric, many vintage Ossie Clark dresses suffer from thread pulls and iron shine. This dress appears to be hardly worn. The crepe fabric is in excellent condition. The elastic at the cuffs has is showing some slight deterioration. This is really a minor issue - there is about half an inch near the seam of each cuff where the elastic has come away. This does not effect the rouching of the cuffs. 

The dress states size 10. It is approximately a UK size 8. Please check the measurements below.

Chest 34"
Waist 26"
Length 56"

If you are buying from outside the UK, please contact us before purchasing this item, as it will require special shipping.

name: Vintage 1970s Radley  Dress
description:
Stunning vintage 1970s dress by Radley. A classic design from the British Boutique Movement, from the company best known for its association with Ossie Clark. 

Fabulous plunging neckline, with gold pleated bodice. Scalloped edged skirt. Tie belt and zip to back.

This dress is in immaculate condition - is possibly even unworn. This is a rare find. 

Size 8 (states size 10)

Chest 34", Waist 26", Length 42"

Exquisite vintage late 1950s/early 1960s dress by Marcel Fenez - Creation de Paris. Beautiful tailoring from this quality label. Medium sheer black fabric over an olive green satin under-slip lining. Velvet trim to neckline and skirt. Multi-pleat edging to skirt. V shape back.

The dress is missing its original belt. It is in very good condition and structurally feels hardly worn. There are two tiny nicks in the fabric. They are both approx 1mm in diameter. Hardly noticeable.

name: Ossie Clark for Radley 1970s Black Crepe Maxi Dress
description:
Original Ossie  Clark for Radley black crepe dress. The simple, flattering lines of this particular dress makes this a classic design from one of the worlds most sought after fashion labels. The Ossie Clark for Radley range was one of the first 'diffusion' lines.  The initial pattern or prototype by Ossie would be translated into a series of stylish, more affordable variations by one of the Radley designers. 
The long-sleeved, black Ossie Clark maxi dresses are very rare and in demand. This one has plunging neckline with fabric covered buttons to front of dress. Tapered waistline and flowing skirt. Zip to back.
The dress is in excellent structural condition. There are some very tiny thread pulls to the crepe in places. 

Approx size 8/10, please check measurements.

Chest 34/36"
Waist 26"
Hips 38"
Length 56"
Across shoulders 16.5"

Reasonable offers will be considered on this item, please contact for more information.
